channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [WFLY-4908] Redeploy dependent ear fails with duplicate resource error for persistence unit
item.description:
I have two EARs:

module1.ear  
|  
+--ejb.jar  
   |  
  +--META-INF  
      |  
      +--persistence.xml with persistence unit "module1-pu"

and 

module2.ear  
|  
+--META-INF  
|  |  
|  +--jboss-all.xml  
|  
+--ejb.jar  
   |  
   +--META-INF  
      |  
      +--persistence.xml with persistence unit "module2-pu"

module2.ear/META-INF/jboss-all.xml contains:

<jboss xmlns="urn:jboss:1.0">  
  <jboss-deployment-dependencies xmlns="urn:jboss:deployment-dependencies:1.0">  
  <dependency name="module1.ear" />  
  </jboss-deployment-dependencies>  
</jboss>

When I redeploy module1.ear, module2.ear not redeployed automatically with error: java.lang.IllegalStateException: WFLYCTL0075: Duplicate resource module2.ear/ejb.jar#module2-pu (on wildfly 8.2.0.Final: java.lang.IllegalStateException: JBAS014666: Duplicate resource module2.ear/ejb.jar#module2-pu)
Full redeploy log:

item.summary: Redeploy dependent ear fails with duplicate resource error for persistence unit

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Still an issue in 10.0.0.CR4. Anyone working on this?
Just looking now, I have a theory as to what the fix might be.
I pushed a potential workaround to https://github.com/scottmarlow/wildfly/tree/WFLY-4908_cleanupmanagementconsole. I haven't tried the https://github.com/jfelix-mgn/wildfly-issue.git test case yet.

The above change doesn't seem to be enough:

WFLYCTL0185: Newly corrected services:
service jboss.deployment.unit."module1.ear".deploymentCompleteService (new available)
If I forced a redeploy of module2.ear (after getting the error mentioned in my previous error), deployment of module2.ear works. This isn't a proper fix but might be a clue to the cause.

This same condition is true for web deployments. I've documented it here:[ https://developer.jboss.org/message/947704#947704].

I really hope that this can be resolved, we have a number of applications that rely on this sort of dependency.

Jason,

From your post on https://developer.jboss.org/message/947704, you didn't mention testing with WildFly 10. I had recreated the problem earlier with an earlier WildFly 10 build but more recently, I could not recreate with WildFly 10 (latest build around November 15, 2015). Could you please also try to recreate with the latest WildFly 10 build?

Nightly builds of WildFly 10 are available at https://community.jboss.org/thread/224262.

Thanks,
Scott

Scott,

I just tried it with Build #2122 and it fails and behaves as the other version. Logs below and attached to this post: https://developer.jboss.org/message/947706#947706

Thanks for trying Jason and also for opening a forum thread. I was wrong in my previous comment, I was thinking of a different issue that I could not recreate any more on WildFly 10.
Please let me know if there is more that I can do. This issues is important to our applications.

FWIW this bug is the only thing keeping us on JBoss AS 7.2. We have a large number of WAR/EAR files and this issue makes development difficult.

Could someone update this to indicate that it affects 10.0.0.CR4 (latest version I tested, 2 months ago)?

Thanks!

FYI, https://github.com/scottmarlow/wildfly/tree/WFLY-4908_cleanupmanagementconsole contains a partial solution. If anyone wants to build with that and test:

  1. git clone https://github.com/scottmarlow/wildfly.git
  2. cd wildfly
  3. git checkout WFLY-4908_cleanupmanagementconsole
  4. ./build.sh clean install -DskipTests=true
  5. cd dist/target/wildfly-10.0.0.CR5-SNAPSHOT/bin
  6. ./standalone.sh

Would be good to know if the partial fix is helpful. When I reproduced this problem with the https://github.com/jfelix-mgn/wildfly-issue.git test case, it wasn't enough but perhaps you will see different results.
Scott Marlow - Build from master or from your issue branch (https://github.com/scottmarlow/wildfly/tree/WFLY-4908_cleanupmanagementconsole)?
The WFLY-4908_cleanupmanagementconsole branch should be used.

Good to hear that the change helps. I think that the fix should be merged but it doesn't completely address the problems reported by the original post. We probably need a separate jira based on the subsequent failure that I mentioned above with https://github.com/jfelix-mgn/wildfly-issue.git.
As far as WildFly 9 goes, this fix needs to go into the next WildFly upstream release (10 or 11).

[~scottmarlow], thanks for working on this.

I tested your branch with https://github.com/jfelix-mgn/wildfly-issue.git. It looks like replacing the dependency works. Our development process is copying new deployments over the old ones (using scripts or links), so this should fix it for us. It would be great if your fix could make it into the next CR/Final.

What is still broken is undeploying the dependency and then redeploying it (i.e. the test case in this ticket). The dependency deploys but the dependent does not redeploy; touching the dependency does cause both to redeploy. I remember having problems with this case in JBoss AS 7 as well, so not really a regression there.

I've cloned https://github.com/jfelix-mgn/wildfly-issue and tested it against the build based on https://github.com/scottmarlow/wildfly/tree/WFLY-4908_cleanupmanagementconsole and it has some interesting results.

  1. Undeploying module1 does produce the expected result, in that it brakes module2 because of the dependency.
  2. Redeploying module1 does produce the logging Scott Marlow cited in this https://issues.jboss.org/browse/WFLY-4908?focusedCommentId=13125152&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13125152 comment.
  3. When view the deployments in the console the are still enabled and seems valid, at least according to the console.
  4. If I look at the console after un-deploying module1, but before redeploying, then the console complains and logs an exception, see below. Not really sure it helps in this case.

I think it is worth noting that WildFly does seem to redeploying both EARs when module1 is re-deployed despite what the logging says.

It seems to me that module2 breaking upon module1 un-deployment should be expected, because of the dependency. Also, it does not seem that unreasonable to me that redeployment might not result in every dependent module deploying cleanly. I kind of this undeploying a module that other modules depend on is a mistake and only should be done under controlled circumstances. That's my $0.02. This is different, in my opinion, from the hot-deploy scenario, which does seem to be fixed in this branch.

I've done some more testing this morning by creating a fork of the original wildfly-issue project: https://github.com/slowtrailrunner/wildfly-issue and added some web modules to each ear so that I could easily test the availability of the modules from a browser. Follow the same steps, originally outlined in this issue, primarily:

  1. Deploy module1.ear from project dir to wildfly server
  2. Deploy module2.ear from project dir to wildfly server
  3. Undeploy module1.ear from wildfly server
  4. Deploy module1.ear from project dir to wildfly server

Test against a build from branch https://github.com/scottmarlow/wildfly/tree/WFLY-4908_cleanupmanagementconsole, I was able to verify that module2 (both modules really) is available after un-deploy and redeploy of module1, despite what is logged.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. Clone example project from github: 

    git clone https://github.com/jfelix-mgn/wildfly-issue.git

  2. Move to project dir and build project with gradle (project contains wrapper). 

    ./gradlew ear

  3. Start wildfly 9.0.0.Final in standalone mode with defaults configurations
  4. Deploy module1.ear from project dir to wildfly server
  5. Deploy module2.ear from project dir to wildfly server
  6. Undeploy module1.ear from wildfly server
  7. Deploy module1.ear from project dir to wildfly server
